title: Cuisinart BRK 100 Brick Oven
transcripts:
Cuisinart® Brick Oven Classic

With 0.9 cubic foot capacity and 1700 watts of power, this brick oven delivers restaurant-quality cooking. Two brick inserts plus baking  Cuisinart Brick Ovenstone help to retain heat for optimal baking performance. Features a fully functional toaster oven/broiler that offers bake, broil and toast. Two wire racks allow for two level baking. Brick oven is a handsome addition to your counter with industrial-style stainless steel housing and tinted glass oven door. Limited three-year warranty. UL Listed. Model # BRK-100.

Cuisinart Brick Oven Classic  Video Transcript

Hi.  Im Mary Rogers, director of marketing communications at Cuisinart.  This is the Cuisinart Classic Brick Oven Toaster Oven.  This is a great product.  It goes up to 1,700 watts of power.  Thats what it uses.  Its lined with bricks.  One is removable.  Two are permanently mounted on the side.  The bricks actually help radiate heat around the oven so you get really, really consistent cooking.  Its also great when youre doing any type of pizza or bread.  It gives it a really, really great crust on the outside.

It has two cooking racks.  When you pull them out, theres a little stop there that keeps them from falling out.  It has a really nice large tray and broiling rack.  The broiling rack; one side is lower than the other.  So you turn it on this side, its deeper in the pan so its further away from the element.  This side makes it closer to the element.  So when youre broiling and you put this in your oven, one of the things we always tell people is to make sure you leave it cracked a little bit.  That helps circulate the hot air around the oven.  Thats really important to do.

Its all stainless steel.  Its beautifully designed.  In the front, we have our function buttons.  We also can do toast in here.  We have light, medium, and dark for toast, and then we have broil, bake, and toast on the function button.  On the left here, this is your temperature button that youll use when youre cooking things like chicken or maybe an apple pie or even brownies.

Additionally, in the back, the crumb tray pulls all the way out from the back, so its really easy to clean.  You just dump it out, wash it, and insert it right back in your toaster oven broiler.  You couldnt get better-tasting baked goods and home-cooked food using the Classic Cuisinart Brick Oven.
